Course Outcomes.CO1: Derive radar systems parameters such as bandwidth, carrier frequency, waveform, power etc. for achieving specific radar characteristics.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Process radar signals to estimate range, velocity and angular positions of targets
Course Outcomes.CO3: Explain the functionalities some common radar applications.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Explain the functionalities some common radar applications.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction - What is radar?, Basic parts of a radar, radar range equation, Information available from a radar, Radar frequencies
Radar Phenomenology - Radar cross section (simple and complex shapes), propagation, clutter and noise
Types of radar - Impulse radar, Doppler radar, MTI and Pulse Doppler Radar, Stepped Frequency and FMCW radar
Radar signal processing - Matched filter, Pulse compression, Synthetic aperture radar and inverse synthetic aperture radar, digital beamforming, space time adaptive processing

Brief Discussion on Common Radar applications - military radar, remote sensing radar, airport surveillance radar, weather / meteorological radar, police radar, ground penetration radar, through-wall radar, automobile radar

Resource Material.Reference Book: Radar Cross Section, SciTech Publishing , E. F. Knott, J. F Shaeffer and M. T. Tuley
